channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4622] Video-Fallback to EN
item.description:
At the moment the situation is like this: If a product has an english video attached in PIM, it is shown in CHen but not in CHde, CHfr.
-> Should be changed to this: If an english video is present, it should be shown aswell in other languages if there isn't a video in the native language.

Requestor: Jan Kroeni

comments.comment:
Hi Rafael,

I have change the behaviour as expected. So means in case if we have en media that will always be displayed.

P.S :- But we don't in that way the en media will be the exact translation of the native language.
Ready for deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4730] Extend archive time for imported CSV files
item.description: For better reconstruction of existing (wrong) data in hybris we keep imported files not only 2 weeks but 2 month.
item.summary: Extend archive time for imported CSV files

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4725] Adjust PIM import and FF export
item.summary: Adjust PIM import and FF export

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4717] 500 ERROR // Checkout Adresses
item.description:
Logged in:
User: schweiz_test
PW: 123456

Add to cart: 101010
Go to step 2 --> Error 500

Status Code:500 Internal Server Error
Request Headersview parsed
GET /checkout/address HTTP/1.1
Host: test.distrelec.ch

--> Problem only appears in Movex countries

comments.comment: Bug was already fixed in trunk, but not in branch v2.0. Fix is now also in place for branch v2.0.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4690] Change of country links in page settings
item.description:
Could you please change the country links to the following countries:

For Portugal: www.dce-electronics.com

For Luxembourg: http://shop-re.ramirez.lu/

For Belgium: http://www.teleson.be/en/products/components-and-interconnection/elfa-distrelec/
item.summary: Change of country links in page settings

comments.comment: The URLs have been directly fixed on the Q/P and will be checked in within the tag v2.0.19

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4686] Barilliance code test on Testing environment (Purchase Confirmation Email)
item.description:
I require the following HTML added to the source code of the template of the Purchase Confirmation Email Template on Testing Environment.

Only particularity is we need to change

{email} for the recipients email address (this is the only dynamic value, careful it appears 9 times)


-------

<img style="border:none; margin:0 0 0 0; padding:0 0 0 0; " src="http://img.barilliance.net/widget_img2.php?a=title&e={email}

&rct=1406555306&s=38254&w=600&nt=4&title=Recommended%20for%20you:&bc=FFFFFF&tc=222222&tfs=15&tf=arial&al=left&ty=e_purchasedrecs&ver=1"/>

item.summary: Barilliance code test on Testing environment (Purchase Confirmation Email)

comments.comment:
Video explanation

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZjaLcrKYIqk

Hi Angel,

You mean that you want to add these html code to the existing email template of Purchase Confirmation Email Template.

Bellow is the structure of the confirmation email content

    1. HEADER include
    2. MOOD IMAGE
    3. CONTENT
    4. order information
    5. payment address
    6. product table
    7. calculation summary
    8. delivery cost
    9. greetings
    10. FOOTER include

Will it be possible for you to hint us where we should include these html. ?

Right after greetings would be perfect for the test. Beware that the

{email}

must be replaced by the actual email of the customer.

Best regards

Angel Munoz

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4590] SEO - URL Duplications Issues - Between Language - rel="alternate" to add
item.description:
Observations :

  • Distrelec.ch, due to the swiss market, have a multilingual website accessible and indexed by crawlers.
  • It is splitted between 3 folder, one for each language and no folder for automatic language detection.
    http://www.distrelec.ch/*
    http://www.distrelec.ch/en/*
    http://www.distrelec.ch/de/*
    http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/*

Impacts :

  • This scenario create a major url language duplication issue.
  • GoogleBot can't crawl properly the website language structure without any indication from our side.
  • GoogleBot crawl ratio on the language structure of our pages :
  • This lead into a major content duplication issue + a really wrong crawlability of the the structure (has to be 33% for every language)
    and finally not be ranked properly inside the search engine result pages.

Demands :

  • All website pages must have a rel="alternate" tag that lead to every language alternatives absolute url path in their html head.
    • Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/ : 
      <link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/" hreflang="x-default" />
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/de/" hreflang="de-ch" />
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/" hreflang="fr-ch" />
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/" hreflang="en-ch" />
    • Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513 : 
      <link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="x-default"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch:-1/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="en-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch:-1/de/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="de-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://www.distrelec.ch:-1/fr/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="fr-ch"/>

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - URL Duplications Issues - Between Language - rel="alternate" to add

comments.comment:
In production check 25/07/14 :

  • Alternate on all pages : NOK

In production check 28/07/14 :

  • Alternate on all pages : NOK

=> Reopening of the issue

test.distrelec.ch live test :
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/" hreflang="x-default"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/en/" hreflang="en-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/de/" hreflang="de-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/fr/" hreflang="fr-ch"/>
The <link is now on the all pages and the issue with the wrong port is solved.

test for :
test.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513 :

<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/" hreflang="x-default"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/en/" hreflang="en-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/de/" hreflang="de-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/fr/" hreflang="fr-ch"/>

it is supposed to be :
test.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513 :

<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="x-default"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="en-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="de-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch/fr/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513" hreflang="fr-ch"/>

Alternate on all pages : NOK
=> Reopening of the issue

(BIG warning here, this can't go live, major negative impact on SEO if it's the case)
Fix implemented.

test for :
test.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/c/cat-L1D_379513 :

<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/" hreflang="x-default"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/en/" hreflang="en-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/de/" hreflang="de-ch"/>
<link rel="alternate" href="http://test.distrelec.ch:-1/fr/" hreflang="fr-ch"/>

same as before

What did you fix ?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4303] Loading time after log in
item.description:
Hi René, as discussed, we should really find a solution to optimize the loading time after login.
Could you please analyze the possibilities?
Thank you.

comments.comment:
@Florian

I've done a small test with my test account and the schweiz_test account.

With my account it takes aprox. 1 sec. display the home page after login.

With the schweiz_test account it takes aprox. 3-4 sec. display the home page after login.

Are there accounts which do take much longer?

1st time login: up to 7s
follow-up login: 3s

  • user to reproduce bad behavior on...
    • Q: User=schweiz_test Pass=123456
    • P: User=schweiz_test Pass=Distrelec14
  • Possible cause:
    • Slow performance (1st time only) of fetching the shopping lists

There are many ModelAttributes on the AbstractPageController.
But the "metaLists" (getDistShoppingListFacade().getMiniWishlists()) and "hasCompareProducts" (compareListFacade.getCompareList()) can take more than 2 seconds to evaluate, if not cached.

The Hybris cache for the flexibleSearch-Queries works quite well as shown in the example. The first call after changing the user, the language or something else, which causes the query not to lookup in the cache, takes very long.

The other examined method calls don't have a big influence...

*************************************************************
First call:

user: schweiz_test
method: shoppingListFacade.getMiniWishlists()
duration: 1.291 seconds
method: userFacade.getTitles()
duration: 0.001 seconds
method: compareListFacade.getCompareList()
duration: 0.812 seconds
method: storeSessionFacade.getAllLanguages()
duration: 0.003 seconds


*************************************************************
Second call:

user: schweiz_test
method: shoppingListFacade.getMiniWishlists()
duration: 0.009 seconds
method: userFacade.getTitles()
duration: 0
method: compareListFacade.getCompareList()
duration: 0.050 seconds
method: storeSessionFacade.getAllLanguages()
duration: 0.003 seconds

It seems the FlexibleSearch is not the problem as it is very fast even in an uncached state.
The problem seems the loading of the products while converting.

NamicsMiniWishlistConverter:

target.setUniqueId(source.getUniqueId());
target.setName(source.getName());
target.setTotalUnitCount(source.getEntries().size()); <-- Here it seems all products will be fetched

Flexible Search to get all required information:

SELECT {l.pk}, {l.uniqueId}, {l.name}, count(*)
FROM {Wishlist2 as l JOIN Wishlist2Entry as e ON {l.pk} = {e.wishlist}}
WHERE {l.user}=8801827127300
AND {l.listType}=8796112060507
GROUP BY {l.pk}, {l.uniqueId}, {l.name}
ORDER BY {l.name}

Retrieve the MiniWishlist directly over the FlexibleSearch without instantiating the Hybris-Models (see query in comment above).

On my local environment the execution time for the uncached case could be improved for shoppingListFacade.getMiniWishlists() from 0.283s to 0.029s and for compareListFacade.getCompareList() from 0.105s to 0.033s.

Also the cleanup code from DISTRELEC-3554 for merging more than one default list will only be executed if the whole list with all the products will be retrieved.
This code may also be moved into an interceptor, cleanup-job or a cleanup-script as it should not be part of a find-method and the ModelService-methods are very bad for the performance.
Even if this part of the code will only executed once, it was executed after the first login after creating more than one default list, which could also be a reason for extremly slow logins.
